intro: Corydalis schanginii subsp. ainae, commonly known as the Ainae Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces slender, ascending stems and has trifoliate leaves with lance-shaped lobes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
